website_summaries.verdict: In spite of a couple of missing accessories that are essential, you will not find a hydration backpack that is better suited for extended outdoor workout sessions.
pros: Holds over 2 liters of water and has enough pockets for snack bars, a phone, a multitool, and other essential items
It's lightweight and doesn't slosh, bounce or contribute to the dreaded "sweaty back" syndrome
cons: There isn't a quick release valve on the water reservoir (necessary for cleaning) or a cover for the bite valve
Those are both necessary accessories that don't cost a lot, but do add to the final cost of this excellent hydration backpack

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the frustration
customer_reviews.text: AMAZON AND TECH CONCEPTS CANT GET THEIR ACT TOGETHER... Tried THREE TIMES ordering this 2016 style hydration pack w/ antidote bladder #62239... Got the 2017 hydration pack delivered THREE TIMES #1120002000 w crux bladder. Unless your looking to be frustrated dont try it. Too bad, would of liked to try the 2016 Rouge which had BETTER reviews.
customer_reviews.author: razor

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: For riding single track mountain bike trails, you rarely have time to grab a water bottle, unless you stop or really slow down. This eliminates that problem! 2 liters of water or whatever fluid. Also r good sized little pouches for phone, keys, wallet, food bars, etc.....
customer_reviews.author: Earle Burns

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a Sieve
customer_reviews.text: Product description states that this is the 2016 model with the Antidote bladder. Instead, they are shipping the 2017 model with the Crux bladder. The Crux bladder has a different closure mechanism and the gasket does not seal at all. Water pours right out regardless of how tight you get it to close. I bought this to replace my really old CamelBak Rogue that is worn out. I am very disappointed in the low quality of the new hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for single person
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to use for my backpacking trips when I'm out during the day. It's good to keep you hydrated during your day activities. It's good for storing small wallets, phone chargers, snack bars, earphones, etc. It's only good if you want to carry stuff for a singleperson and not two or more.
customer_reviews.author: Saetric

customer_reviews.title: Buy this sooner than later!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this! I can't believe I waited so long to buy one of these. I bought the yellow green color because it was the cheapest; however, I'm glad I did because my friends can easily spot me in a crowd. I'm glad I bought this one instead of a smaller version because the zippered pouch is big enough to hold my keys, phone, wallet, and other small items. Also, there's another pouch that can hold a few bottles of water, which I need for longer hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Justine C

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: they shipped me the inferior 2017 version instead
customer_reviews.text: They shipped me the 2017 version instead of the 2016 version that the listing promised. If you look at reviews of the 2017 version, you will see that there are a lot of complaints about leaking and other issues whereas the 2016 version is almost universally loved. Not sure if there's still a way to get the 2016 version.
customer_reviews.author: T. O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: I am never comfortable wearing it
customer_reviews.text: A tight fit. I am only 5'8" but I have wide shoulders. I am never comfortable wearing it. It works as described but I will say any water left in the hose between the storage chamber and mouthpiece will taste bad but if you drain it or just spit it out on the first draw you will be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for long bicycle trips and just got a chance to use it yesterday on a 40 miler. I only filled it about halfway, but it was extremely comfortable and did the job. Lots of pockets to stash everything and my iPhone 7 plus fit (which it doesn't in most bike bags). This will be a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: cellis

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I've known Camelbak products are supposed to be some of the best consumer-level products in their categories, especially with their Hydration Packs. I saw a good deal on the Rogue one day on Amazon and decided to bite, despite having purchased an off-brand for $25 just a couple months earlier. Normally I'm all about off-brand products as long as they are similar, but this Camelbak product really is superior. The pack itself is lighter, more comfortable, and has more storage room. I can honestly say that at this point I understand the extra cost is worth it when you purchase a Camelbak product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Ullom

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I ride in central texas. In the dead of summer, i really should have gone with a larger capacity. I end up having to refill at public water fountains on occasion(i also ride for a couple of hours at a time. The pocket storage is plenty for what i bring( wallet, phone, keys, pocket knife). Very durable. I ride a mountain bike and have taken this thing off jumps and put many miles on it. I don't even feel like i have something strapped to my back. I would definitely recommend this brand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Day Hikes
customer_reviews.text: Gotta Love Camelbak products. This is my 4th Camelbak hydration pack that I have purchased. One for my husband, one for me, one that I used when I was a lot younger, and one as a gift for another adult. I haven't had a single one fail. We have Camelbak packs that have been working perfectly for 15 years. We only updated for a larger size and more carrying space. This particular pack has just enough space for your essentials like a phone, wallet, and keys plus a small snack. No bulky pack that will get in the way. Perfect for day hikes or even trips to amusement parks.
customer_reviews.author: natalie.b.

customer_reviews.title: Won’t Carrying Everything You Want; Will Carry Everything You Need
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 20 mile trail race. I was able to carry all my water with an electrolyte, 4 food pouches, A protein bar Micro first aid kit with medicine Ruger LCP Streamlight microstream Keys Leatherman Style CS Earbuds and phone charger pack Spare shirt through the straps KaBar TDI Karambif I finished my race with very little chafing and was completely satisfied. Get Darwinian with your loadout. It’ll get you there.
customer_reviews.author: Tio

customer_reviews.title: Was Perfect for the Spartan Beast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for long obstacle course races and I was not disappointed. I filled this up numerous times and it was easy. There is a flap that opens and then you have access to a large opening. The bag itself is good because it has numerous zippered pockets. I was able to keep Clif bars, peanut butter packets, Clif Bloks, KT tape, and even a spare set of disposible contacts (just in case). Also, the fit was great and I could run and didn't even notice that I was carrying 2 liters of water on my back. I would recommend to anybody serious about getting into OCR racing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Hands-free Safe Hydration While Hiking and Biking!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these thus far. I especially like them for bicycling. I felt it was a much safer way to keep hydrated, so one needn't take a hand off the handlebars to grab a bottle, or lose focus on the road. These are very beautifully, sturdily made!! These are well worth the price, because you really don't want something that may leak, or puncture, or impart an off or plastic-y taste to the water. There are cheaper versions, but they are not going to last as well, and I realized I'd end up paying the same amount, buying replacements. Buy this once and keep it!
customer_reviews.author: Sea-song by moonlight

customer_reviews.title: A great unit!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this at the request of our daughter several years ago! She enjoys outdoor concerts and she loves her CamelBak! She is not only able to store a significant amount of water, but the extra pockets make it a convenient carrying case for her phone, ID, etc. She does clean it on a regular basis and it has held up nicely!

customer_reviews.title: Great pack, perfect storage pockets.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Perfect pockets for storage of phone, wallet, and keys and any other essentials. We use them for bike riding and rollerblading, The packs are light and have adjustable straps that make them nice and tight around you. Cleaning is no harder than a standard camelback. The bladder and tubes come out and go back easily. The bladder also has some nice drying legs built into it. My only problem with them is that they don't provide any insulation for the drinks but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: PETER D

customer_reviews.title: ... for Spartan Races and they all are quality with great features. These packs hold up and can take ...
customer_reviews.text: I have three different models of Camelbaks that I use for Spartan Races and they all are quality with great features. These packs hold up and can take a serious beating and still look new. They machine wash great and air dry fast, I can't imagine using a different product for my hydration needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Peltz

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended. Wife Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: we use this all the time while hiking. My wife likes this one, because it's lightweight, but carries plenty of water. Even a little room for keys/wallet/GPS/etc. The small size and design also provides a nice style. Highly Recommended. Fairly easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Cody mast

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water pack for music festivals!

Pockets are small but I chose this size on purpose and they had plenty of room for what I wanted, especially with the adjustable straps. Loosen those straps and you can easily fit a bottle in there even with the zippered pocket being full and the bladder filled up. There is a slight plasticy taste to the water but it has been slowly going away with use and it isn't present at all when the water is cold enough. Great pack! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John Shifflet

customer_reviews.title: easily takes the rigors of offroading and repeated cleanings from ...

It has the right amount of storage for gear, tools, phone, foods, and fluids for a solid half-plus-day of self-sustained riding. Well made, easily takes the rigors of offroading and repeated cleanings from regular usage. Extra bonus, the bright "lemon green" colorway is a perfect match for Pearl Izumi's hi-viz cycling jackets.
customer_reviews.author: Carbon Black

customer_reviews.title: Love this CamelBak
customer_reviews.text: Love this CamelBak, mainly for the color! It's very easy to remove the cap and refill and has enough room in the pockets to put your phone and wallet in it. The only drawback for me is that there is no quick-release for the hydration pack. This isn't really an issue, but more of an annoyance as I like to place the hydration pack in the fridge the night before I go hiking. Overall, good quality and it's lasted me through numerous events and camping trips!

Without the water bladder, the top flap, flaps wildly. It uses the bladder to hold it securely. Anyway, good small pack for short rides or hikes. Well built too.
customer_reviews.author: cheslin

customer_reviews.title: I don't ride my bike without it!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of storage for what you need to take with you and still remain light. I carry vehicle keys, 2 ammo magazines, a flashlight, sunglass case and I still have room for snack bars/food. With 2L of water I am able to ride my bike for about 3 hours maybe a little less if its hot out (85F is hot to me) before I have to refill. I go off road a lot and you can hear the water slushing around a little but at no bother to me, I would recommend this and a valve cover to anyone wanting to stay hydrated while doing whatever gets you going.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack.

customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for mountain biking

Fits my Nexus 6, credit cards/ID/money, chapstick, 2 5 hour energy shots, a compact makeup, protein bar, and then some.
customer_reviews.author: speesea

customer_reviews.title: for the casual hiker or cyclist I think this is great. I'm about 5'5"

My only gripe is that it is difficult to completely dry out the tube, making it prone to developing mold. If Camelback would include some tool specifically for this purpose I would have given it a 5-star rating.

I tried lowering the sternum straps, but they are still near my neck when I clip them together. I also wish there was another clip for the hose, as it kind of dangles around when hiking. Overall though, great product to have for long trips, especially since I drink a lot of liquid during any kind of physical activity,

customer_reviews.author: drinsd

customer_reviews.author: H. Powers

customer_reviews.title: I love this camelbak
customer_reviews.text: I love this camelbak! I mainly use it for snowboarding, as it is a perfect size to hold electronics, snacks, keys, wallet, and obviously water. I have filled this up with gatorade before and it works great. Even cleaning it out wasn't too much of an issue. I've also used this for mountain biking and the slim design is nice and doesn't weigh you down or feel too obtrusive. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dom&Mak

customer_reviews.title: I like to have the water in the Camelbak because I'm ...

We ride for 30 miles on Sunday, so you need the extra water. Very reasonably priced and a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: kellikay

customer_reviews.title: Good

customer_reviews.author: KT

This package does not come with the quick release hose connections - those are available separately. I bought the insulated hose and quick connect to refit this package. Looks to be made as light as possible and I like the pockets for keys, wallet and energy packets. Almost $30 off the price at the sports stores.
customer_reviews.author: dawjr

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack

customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a day hike of a couple hours. Enough space for some food, layers and sunblock.

Expensive, but worth it in the long run.

I may get a bigger bladder tho it kinda runs out quick so this isn't really good for hardcore mountain biking deep in the woods you'd wanna get a 2 liter camelbak for that but this one is great for around the town or 1.5 hour hard cardio sesssions

customer_reviews.text: Great size for both the amount of fluid and storage. I can fit all my cycling tools, some tubes, Co2 in the bottom pouch; All my food in the top pouch; And even throw a long sleeve shirt/cover in between the bladder and lining!

customer_reviews.author: AnnetteWI

customer_reviews.title: ... MANY years and decided to get the latest and greatest rather than just replace the reservoir
customer_reviews.text: I have used the original Camelbak Rogue for MANY years and decided to get the latest and greatest rather than just replace the reservoir, hose, and bite valve. My only wish is that they had maintained the adjustable strap between the top and lower compartments - I found an amazing number of uses for that thing!
customer_reviews.author: RStarr

customer_reviews.title: awesome pac!!

customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a short hike. Just enough room to take my basic hiking items (first aid kit, whistle, small needle nose pliers etc) and a power bar and some nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel Gali

customer_reviews.text: Its a camelbak. It does what it is supposed to and has no issues thus far. Aside from any potential issues down the road due to wear, you should know what you're buying when you buy a camelbak.

customer_reviews.title: stitching failed during first use
customer_reviews.text: The stitching on the chest strap tore off 30min into wearing it. I did a test for at home to adjust the straps and thought it was good to go. I reached up to close the canopy of a truck and it burst right at the seam. You can hardly see where it was originally stitched together, one small line and not very robust. Usually camelbak's are pretty solid, but not this one. Hopefully the warranty will cover it.
customer_reviews.author: Vader

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a lifesaver when going on hikes or cross country, and you'll look cool doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Ksaku

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for a Spartan Beast race in Tahoe. ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for a Spartan Beast race in Tahoe. Holds a bunch of gel packs, headlamp and a little room to spare
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Great for a walk in the park, not if you want to bring essential tools
customer_reviews.text: This hydration bag is for the minimalist. Does not have much room for biking tools, if you plan on using it for a ride. When full, the bag is very difficult to get into the compartment. It is best to slide the empty bag into the compartment and then fill it.
customer_reviews.author: Kingkongmegatron

customer_reviews.title: Everything i had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an 8 mile trail/obsticle race and it held enough water for my dog and I as well as food gel, dog treats and of course my phone so I could document the whole thing. Fits great, doesn't shift around when completing awkward movements, and a nice low profile so I could still fit under stuff. The hose does just dangle and got dirty constantly but small price to pay to have water I guess. Love this pack
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple years and its worked great, I've used it while mowing the lawn, hiking, biking or just about anytime I want a hands free water bottle on me. I've used it well over 200 times and its been through the ringer but looks no worse for wear. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: A Welder's Dream
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself to wear at Welding school. Fits under my gear. Keeps me cool with ice cubes on extremely hot days. It even has my name on it..Rogue. The red color matches my jacket. Convenient. Affordable. Keeps me hydrated for 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: ROGUE

customer_reviews.title: Festival Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Camelbak for music festivals and hiking and so far it has proved its worth. It holds enough water for a good distance hike and it also is very easy to use. It's extremely comfotable and has plenty of pockets to hold your keys, wallets, portable chargers, etc. its really hard to beat for the price. Also they have a great selction of colors (I went with black). Another great feature it has is reflective material on the back so if you run or hike during night You will be able to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: No quick release like all the other Antidote bladers. 😕
customer_reviews.text: I really like the pack but the 2L Antidote reservoir that comes with the pack is not the one with the quick release tube which was the main reason I purchased the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It is super convenient for biking
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves it! It is super convenient for biking, and an added plus is how many little pockets it has!
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: good condition. This is a great product
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time and in new, good condition. This is a great product. I just bought one for each of my boys. I've been using mine for years now.
customer_reviews.author: Meg S. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cyclists and Runners
customer_reviews.text: I got the women’s version of this hydration pack for my birthday and loved it so much I bought the Rogue for my boyfriend’s birthday. Camelback makes excellent products. The Rogue is specific for cyclist but can be used for running as well. There is ample room to put cycling tools, Stinger bars/gels, and a spare tire. For longer rides, the 70 ounce capacity is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JAY

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Quality of Product
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with the DPO mailing service as it took just a week. I ordered two of these camel backs and immediately took them out on a 24 mile bike ride. My wife and I are very happy with the quality of the product as it far exceeded expectation. After 24 miles of a ride, the camelbacks felt fine in our backs.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Romero

customer_reviews.title: Little small, but my guy is a little big ...
customer_reviews.text: Little small, but my guy is a little big. Its not that big once you slip it on your back. Almost more made for a girl. It seems to do the job. Its Lightweight, holds about 2 small bottled waters, maybe more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you are not a 5'3 woman try a different option.
customer_reviews.text: While the bladder is .5L bigger then my previous pack the structure of this item is for small women. Sizing says unisex but at 6'2 I must not fall into that category.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny55

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this item! really helps keep my hydrated during the summer on camping trips/hikes/festivals
customer_reviews.author: Cristine Wu

customer_reviews.title: Works for my son to hike with
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son's campingtrip and 11 mile hike. Works great. Great that he could wear this on his back (he's 11) and not have to carry bottles of water. It does not have a lot of space to carry other items. He was able to bring a small flashlight, energy bars, bandaids.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Mouth piece broke within minutes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my 11year old son. Within 2 hours the mouth piece was leaking. The tip of the mouth piece began to break away on the side creating a tiny ant size hole. I was a little disappointed because I watched several YouTube videos about how durable and well tested these parts were. Aside from that, great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Really love this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really love this purchase. After doing a decent amount of hiking over the last 4 months, I've really enjoyed the pack. It's a lot better than hauling a number of water bottles around and is super lightweight and comfortable. The best part for me were the extra pockets. They were large enough to hold my wallet, keys, phones, and snacks.
customer_reviews.author: NiceGuy

customer_reviews.title: The lid is just a pain to screw on without ...
customer_reviews.text: The lid is just a pain to screw on without spilling water everywhere. It takes me a couple tries to even get it to
customer_reviews.author: lilyhammer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Me Hydrated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for hiking and also for Spartan Races that I participate in. Not only is this very convenient, but it is high quality. Also, the two pockets are nice for carrying my keys and such when hiking or energy gels during races.
customer_reviews.author: J. Coberly

customer_reviews.title: The lid is a little difficult to put on properly ...
customer_reviews.text: The lid is a little difficult to put on properly, but the pack works as expected without issue. Unfortunately the color has faded from its original bright hi-viz yellow after a summer of frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: goldy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for every MTB/bicycle ride
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my Dad who wont MTB without it. His chain broke the other day and lucky for him he had a Camelbak carrying his tools. I have had my Camelbak since 2007 and its still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Willetts

customer_reviews.title: Love CamelBak products!
customer_reviews.text: I'm prior Army and we were always issued CamelBak hydration for our missions. LOVE this brand and the quality. The bladder is easy to open & easy to unlatch the top flap. Plenty of of room for snacks, and a key holder in the top zipper pocket :) I live in Austin, TX and I do a lot of hiking, bike riding and also perfect for festivals. EDIT: I finally remembered to take a pic of the camel bak with a ful bladder. Top pocket can hold your keys and Anker Powercore charger. Just to give you an idea. Hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great pack. Lightweight and yet holds a nice amount ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. Lightweight and yet holds a nice amount of water. For me, the actual storage of the pack is enough to carry a couple of glasses cases, wallets, and sunscreen. Perfect for hiking, music festivals, or really any activity. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: ckrapp

customer_reviews.title: It's a "men's" pack but it can work for anyone
customer_reviews.text: It's a "men's" pack but it can work for anyone. This is an awesome back. I bought this for my wife who is 5'4" and it fits great on her and on me 6'1". It's not heavy when full and there is room for cell phones, keys and granola bars.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: The hydration pak work as illustrated in the demonstrate as advertised. It is strongly built have not encountered any problems a great backpak enough room to carry the necessary items you may need. The price was right would recommend it to anyone.

product_meta.title: CamelBak 2016 Rogue Hydration Pack
product_meta.description: The convenience of external fill in a sleek bike pack. The 2L Antidote reservoir can be refilled on the fly via the quick-release flap on the front of the pack. Two external pockets for small items like keys, wallet, phone or storage for a shed layer. Stretch elastic side panels provide for expansion; twin compression straps shrink pack down when empty. Reflective back strip with tab to click on a blinker for early morning and evening safety.
feature_bullets: One interior slip pocket. Two exterior pockets
